intro: Acer neapolitanum, commonly known as the Naples maple, is a deciduous tree native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, red, winged samaras that are dispersed by wind. It typically grows to a height of 8–12 meters and prefers well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and parks.
